verses.verse: And when Balaam <WH1109> saw <WH7200> that it pleased <WH5869> <WH2895> the LORD <WH3068> to bless <WH1288> Israel <WH3478>, he went <WH1980> not, as at other times <WH6471>, to seek <WH7125> for enchantments <WH5173>, but he set <WH7896> his face <WH6440> toward the wilderness <WH4057>. to seek: Heb. to the meeting of

And Balaam <WH1109> lifted up <WH5375> his eyes <WH5869>, and he saw <WH7200> Israel <WH3478> abiding <WH7931> in his tents according to their tribes <WH7626>; and the spirit <WH7307> of God <WH430> came upon him.

And he took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> hath said <WH5002>, and the man <WH1397> whose eyes <WH5869> are open <WH8365> hath said <WH5002>: whose: Heb. who had his eyes shut, but now opened

He hath said <WH5002>, which heard <WH8085> the words <WH561> of God <WH410>, which saw <WH2372> the vision <WH4236> of the Almighty <WH7706>, falling <WH5307> into a trance, but having his eyes <WH5869> open <WH1540>:
How goodly <WH2895> are thy tents <WH168>, O Jacob <WH3290>, and thy tabernacles <WH4908>, O Israel <WH3478>!

As the valleys <WH5158> are they spread forth <WH5186>, as gardens <WH1593> by the river's side <WH5104>, as the trees of lign aloes <WH174> which the LORD <WH3068> hath planted <WH5193>, and as cedar trees <WH730> beside the waters <WH4325>.

He shall pour <WH5140> the water <WH4325> out <WH5140> of his buckets <WH1805>, and his seed <WH2233> shall be in many <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, and his king <WH4428> shall be higher <WH7311> than Agag <WH90>, and his kingdom <WH4438> shall be exalted <WH5375>.

God <WH410> brought him forth <WH3318> out of Egypt <WH4714>; he hath as it were the strength <WH8443> of an unicorn <WH7214>: he shall eat up <WH398> the nations <WH1471> his enemies <WH6862>, and shall break <WH1633> their bones <WH6106>, and pierce <WH4272> them through with his arrows <WH2671>.

He couched <WH3766>, he lay down <WH7901> as a lion <WH738>, and as a great lion <WH3833>: who shall stir him up <WH6965>? Blessed <WH1288> is he that blesseth <WH1288> thee, and cursed <WH779> is he that curseth <WH779> thee.

And Balak's <WH1111> anger <WH639> was kindled <WH2734> against Balaam <WH1109>, and he smote <WH5606> his hands <WH3709> together <WH5606>: and Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> unto Balaam <WH1109>, I called <WH7121> thee to curse <WH6895> mine enemies <WH341>, and, behold, thou hast altogether <WH1288> blessed <WH1288> them these three <WH7969> times <WH6471>.

Therefore now flee <WH1272> thou to thy place <WH4725>: I thought <WH559> to promote <WH3513> thee unto great <WH3513> honour <WH3513>; but, lo, the LORD <WH3068> hath kept thee back <WH4513> from honour <WH3519>.
And Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> unto Balak <WH1111>, Spake <WH1696> I not also to thy messengers <WH4397> which thou sentest <WH7971> unto me, saying <WH559>,

If Balak <WH1111> would give <WH5414> me his house <WH1004> full <WH4393> of silver <WH3701> and gold <WH2091>, I cannot <WH3201> go beyond <WH5674> the commandment <WH6310> of the LORD <WH3068>, to do <WH6213> either good <WH2896> or bad <WH7451> of mine own mind <WH3820>; but what the LORD <WH3068> saith <WH1696>, that will I speak <WH1696>?

And now, behold, I go <WH1980> unto my people <WH5971>: come <WH3212> therefore, and I will advertise <WH3289> thee what this people <WH5971> shall do <WH6213> to thy people <WH5971> in the latter <WH319> days <WH3117>.

And he took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> hath said <WH5002>, and the man <WH1397> whose eyes <WH5869> are open <WH8365> hath said <WH5002>:

He hath said <WH5002>, which heard <WH8085> the words <WH561> of God <WH410>, and knew <WH3045> the knowledge <WH1847> of the most High <WH5945>, which saw <WH2372> the vision <WH4236> of the Almighty <WH7706>, falling <WH5307> into a trance, but having his eyes <WH5869> open <WH1540>:

I shall see <WH7200> him, but not now: I shall behold <WH7789> him, but not nigh <WH7138>: there shall come <WH1869> a Star <WH3556> out of Jacob <WH3290>, and a Sceptre <WH7626> shall rise <WH6965> out of Israel <WH3478>, and shall smite <WH4272> the corners <WH6285> of Moab <WH4124>, and destroy <WH6979> all the children <WH1121> of Sheth <WH8352> <WH8351>. smite: or, smite through the princes of
And Edom <WH123> shall be a possession <WH3424>, Seir <WH8165> also shall be a possession <WH3424> for his enemies <WH341>; and Israel <WH3478> shall do <WH6213> valiantly <WH2428>.
Out of Jacob <WH3290> shall come he that shall have dominion <WH7287>, and shall destroy <WH6> him that remaineth <WH8300> of the city <WH5892>.

And when he looked <WH7200> on Amalek <WH6002>, he took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Amalek <WH6002> was the first <WH7225> of the nations <WH1471>; but his latter <WH319> end shall be that he perish <WH8> for ever <WH5703>. the nations: the nations that warred against Israel that: or, even to destruction

And he looked <WH7200> on the Kenites <WH7017>, and took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Strong <WH386> is thy dwellingplace <WH4186>, and thou puttest <WH7760> thy nest <WH7064> in a rock <WH5553>.

Nevertheless the Kenite <WH7014> shall <WH518> be wasted <WH1197>, until Asshur <WH804> shall carry thee away captive <WH7617>. the Kenite: Heb. Kain until: or, how long shall it be ere Asshur carry thee away captive
And he took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Alas <WH188>, who shall live <WH2421> when God <WH410> doeth <WH7760> this!

And ships <WH6716> shall come from the coast <WH3027> of Chittim <WH3794>, and shall afflict <WH6031> Asshur <WH804>, and shall afflict <WH6031> Eber <WH5677>, and he also shall perish <WH8> for ever <WH5703>.
And Balaam <WH1109> rose up <WH6965>, and went <WH3212> and returned <WH7725> to his place <WH4725>: and Balak <WH1111> also went <WH1980> his way <WH1870>.
